TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit SortedDictionary`2/KeyCollection<TKey, TValue> extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<!TKey>, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<!TKey>, class System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection`1<!TKey>, class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

type SortedDictionary<'Key, 'Value>.KeyCollection = class interface ICollection<'Key> interface ICollection interface IReadOnlyCollection<'Key> interface seq<'Key> interface IEnumerable

summary.span: 表示 中密钥的集合。

span.span: Represents the collection of keys in a .
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性返回此类型包含中的所有键的实例。The property returns an instance of this type, containing all the keys in that . 中的键的顺序中元素的顺序相同中的关联值的顺序相同返回的属性。The order of the keys in the is the same as the order of elements in the , the same as the order of the associated values in the returned by the property. 不是静态副本，而是，反过来引用在原始密钥。The is not a static copy; instead, the refers back to the keys in the original . 因此，更改为继续反映在。Therefore, changes to the continue to be reflected in the .

threadsafe.span: 公共静态 (在 Visual Basic 中) 的此类型的成员是线程安全。

span.span: Public static ( in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 但不保证所有实例成员都是线程安全的。

span.span: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 一个，只要不修改该集合可以同时支持多个读取器。

span.span: A can support multiple readers concurrently, as long as the collection is not modified.

threadsafe.span: 即便如此，枚举整个集合本质上不是线程安全的过程。

span.span: Even so, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration.

threadsafe.span: 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。

span.span: To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不是静态副本，而是，反过来引用在原始密钥。The is not a static copy; instead, the refers back to the keys in the original . 因此，更改为继续反映在。Therefore, changes to the continue to be reflected in the . 此构造函数是 o （1） 操作。This constructor is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素被复制到按相同顺序枚举器循环访问数组。The elements are copied to the array in the same order in which the enumerator iterates through the . 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is .

summary.span: 返回循环访问 的枚举数。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .
A structure for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。You must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一对象，直到调用。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法是 O (log n) 操作，其中 n 是集合中的元素数。This method is an O(log n) operation where n is a number of elements in a collection.

summary.span: 返回一个循环访问集合的枚举器。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

returns.span: 可用于循环访问集合的 。

span.span: An that can be used to iterate through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义属性。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，您必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一对象，直到调用。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，枚举器就会放在此集合中最后一个元素之后，且 将返回 false。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns false. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也会返回 false。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return false. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法是 O (log n) 操作，其中 n 是集合中的元素数。This method is an O(log n) operation where n is a number of elements in a collection.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean Implements ICollection.IsSynchronized

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示是否同步对 的访问（线程安全）。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether access to the is synchronized (thread safe).

value.span: 如果对 的访问是同步的（线程安全），则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if access to the is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, .

value.span: 在 的默认实现中，此属性始终返回 。

span.span: In the default implementation of , this property always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 属性返回一个对象，可用于同步对。The property returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 同步是所有线程访问集合之前都锁定的对象时才有效。Synchronization is effective only if all threads lock the object before accessing the collection. 获取此属性的值是 o （1） 操作。Getting the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

span.span: In the default implementation of , this property always returns the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义属性。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，您必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一个对象，直到或调用。The property returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法是 O (log n) 操作，其中 n 是集合中的元素数。This method is an O(log n) operation where n is a number of elements in a collection.
